string_table.name: npnxabnsnfns11111101101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: You do not have the right to view your educational records until you graduate.
You feel that your final grade has been entered incorrectly. You have the right to request to amend this, right?
Upon your request, your spouse can contact the university to receive your educational record.

Your educational record was given to a company, who you have an interview with, without your consent. During your interview they ask you questions regarding your educational record that you wanted to keep private. What should you do?

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: Michael was rushing to finish his midterm paper. He did not have enough time to write it himself, so he decided to take pieces of work he found online and add to his to meet the length requirement. When Dr. Bob scanned Michaelâ€™s paper into his plagiarism site, it showed up as 90% plagiarized. Since Dr. Bob clearly stated in his syllabus a paper showing 20% or more in plagiarism will result in failure, Dr. Bob failed Michael and wrote a note on his educational record.
An educational record is any documentation maintained by the university that may contain identifiable information.

Sally is finishing up her 2nd year of college. She is anticipating her final grades. Her professor listed her final exam at a 95%, she has calculated her final grade to be an A at 92%. Her professor just posted their final grades and marked Sallyâ€™s as a 65%, D. Sally is in tears. Is there anything Sally can do to confirm her final grade?

Nathan is a 2nd year student at Wright State University and is 21 years old. Nathan and his parents made a deal when he started college. If he kept his grade point average no lower than a 3.0, his parents would pay his tuition, but Nathan had to pay for his living expenses.

A Congressman has requested to receive a list of students who have a GPA of 3.5 of higher to be recognized for their accomplishments. The graduating students on this list will also be considered for a full-time position being offered as well. Under what circumstance would the Congressman be allowed to obtain this list?

John is a member of the journalism club and is looking to recruit students. He has specific requirements for the students he is recruiting. The potential members have to have a specific major, be a sophomore standing and be a full-time student. He remembered that you are on a student selection committee and wants your help finding the perfect student. Are you allowed to provide this information to John?

Requesting the best letters of recommendation for your specialty requires applying strategy and planning ahead.

Click on each of the boxes to read the steps.
